title: Lesson 66
paragraph: This lesson covers darkness and negativity, including malevolence, sinisterness, and ominousness.

words.meaning: having or showing a wish to do evil to others
words.example: The villain had a malevolent plan.

words.meaning: giving the impression that something harmful or evil is happening
words.example: There was a sinister shadow lurking in the alley.
The dark clouds looked ominous before the storm.

words.meaning: a feeling that something bad will happen
words.example: She felt a sense of foreboding about the journey.
The nefarious scheme was uncovered by the detective.
He gave her a baleful glare.

words.meaning: characterized by an abnormal interest in disturbing subjects
words.example: He had a morbid fascination with crime stories.

words.meaning: intending or intended to do harm
words.japaneseMeaning: 悪意のある、意地の悪い
words.example: The malicious rumor hurt her reputation.
The grim reality of war affected everyone.

words.meaning: disturbing and horrifying because of involvement with or depiction of death
words.example: The story had a macabre ending.
